description:
202X A.D., a future beyond Initial D.

Self-driving cars are in widespread use in Japan, and public roadways are used for auto racing. In such an era, a race called MFG has become popular around the globe. Porsche, Ferrari, Lamborghini… Participants are invited to race with their fastest cars. One such participant, a British racing school graduate, Kanata Rivington, returns to Japan to achieve his goal.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

name.native: ミハイル・ベッケンバウアー

alternative: Ryou Takashi (リョウ・タカハシ)

name.native: ジャクソン・テイラー

node.description:
Shuichi Shigeno is a Japanese manga artist famous for creating Initial D. Shigeno has also created Baribari Densetsu, Dopkan, and Tunnel Nuketara Sky Blue all prior to the manga that would make him famous in 1995. In 1985, he received the Kodansha Manga Award in shounen for Bari Bari Densetsu.

He owns a 1980s Toyota Sprinter Trueno with a panda white color scheme, like Initial D's main character Takumi. He also owns a Sonic Blue Mica-colored 1999 WRX Type STi Version 6 with an STi sports bumper (a part from the STi sport catalogue made to look like the 22B STi bumper but fits non-wide body Imprezas) just like Takumi's father, Bunta. One of his notable students is Jyoji Morikawa, creator of Hajime no Ippo.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2876412506)

Representative director of [Felix Film](https://anilist.co/studio/6126/). Adept in animation and composite work.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/i/user/110221339) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/815589398720847872)

He joined studio Bebow in 1982, where he was referred to by [Masayuki Yagi](https://anilist.co/staff/143406/), a senior of his at Engaru High School. [Yoshikazu Yasuhiko](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/) and Bebow’s founder [Tomonori Kogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/105957/) were also graduates of the same school - the latter whom he would study under after joining the studio. There he made his debut as a key animator on [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/) in the following year.

He left Bebow in the mid ‘80s and joined Pack, a small studio established by [Hiroyuki Kitazume](https://anilist.co/staff/106775/). During this time he was a follower of Kitazume’s, who has said that Onda was the one capable of replicating his drawing’s the best out of the people who worked at studio Pack. After that he joined [Atelier Giga](https://anilist.co/staff/106775/) and worked there until becoming a freelancer.

His drawings feature western-influenced delicate and sharp linework with an excellent grasp on three-dimensionality. His character art in particular is highly praised both inside and outside of the industry, which he gets to brandish whenever he works as an animation supervisor. He has stated that he prefers character design and supervision work over working as an animator himself.

In 2003, he took part as a key animator on [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/)'s animated segment in Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" directed by [Kazuto Nakazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101474/). He is also a huge fan of shoujo manga since a young age due to his older sister.

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/i/user/110221339) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/815589398720847872)

He joined studio Bebow in 1982, where he was referred to by [Masayuki Yagi](https://anilist.co/staff/143406/), a senior of his at Engaru High School. [Yoshikazu Yasuhiko](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/) and Bebow’s founder [Tomonori Kogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/105957/) were also graduates of the same school - the latter whom he would study under after joining the studio. There he made his debut as a key animator on [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/) in the following year.

He left Bebow in the mid ‘80s and joined Pack, a small studio established by [Hiroyuki Kitazume](https://anilist.co/staff/106775/). During this time he was a follower of Kitazume’s, who has said that Onda was the one capable of replicating his drawing’s the best out of the people who worked at studio Pack. After that he joined [Atelier Giga](https://anilist.co/staff/106775/) and worked there until becoming a freelancer.

His drawings feature western-influenced delicate and sharp linework with an excellent grasp on three-dimensionality. His character art in particular is highly praised both inside and outside of the industry, which he gets to brandish whenever he works as an animation supervisor. He has stated that he prefers character design and supervision work over working as an animator himself.

In 2003, he took part as a key animator on [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/)'s animated segment in Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" directed by [Kazuto Nakazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101474/). He is also a huge fan of shoujo manga since a young age due to his older sister.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/christiancodenottimusic)

**Christian Codenotti** is an Italian Eurobeat artist, most commonly known by his alias Ace.

He's also a member of the Eurobeat duo [Go 2](https://anilist.co/staff/277287/Go-2) with [Ennio Zanini](https://anilist.co/staff/129881/Ennio-Zanini).

Insert Song Lyrics ("Break Out Fire"; PV3, ep 2)

node.description:
Dave Rodgers is an Italian songwriter, composer, and producer.

Dave Rodgers, considered by many as the "father of Eurobeat", wrote and produced over 2500 songs for many famous artists, like the J-POP singer [Namie Amuro](https://anilist.co/staff/101167/Namie-Amuro) ( Try Me, Watashi Shinjite), [V6](https://anilist.co/staff/168540/V6) ( Ultraman Tiga, Take me higher), [Max](https://anilist.co/staff/285959/MAX) and many others.

A handful of these songs are used in the Initial D anime and video games. He's also apart of the Eurobeat group [The Spiders From Mars](https://anilist.co/staff/277077/The-Spiders-From-Mars). He was married to [Alessandra Mirka Gatti](https://anilist.co/staff/321715) with whom he had one son, [Federico Pasquini](https://anilist.co/staff/321713).
Evelina Somenzi is an Italian Eurobeat writer from Mantua and one of the founders of SCP Music. She is married to Stefano Castagna.

edges.role: Insert Song Lyrics ("Break Out Fire"; PV3, ep 2)

node.description:
Francesca Contini is an Italian Eurobeat songwriter. She was a model and stage artist as Norma Sheffield in the first half of 90's, as well a composer of numerous songs of Norma Sheffield from the late 90's. Although all songs were sung by [Chiaro de Perri](https://anilist.co/staff/273449/Chiaro-de-Perri).

She is the sister of [Alberto Contini](https://anilist.co/staff/351189/Alberto-Contini).

node.description: Italian composer, saxophonist, and singer in 80s the member of Aleph band beside [Giancarlo Pasquini](https://anilist.co/staff/126216/Dave-Rodgers).

__Height:__ 161 cm (5'3")

 [Twitter](https://twitter.com/iRis_a_himi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/himika_akaneya_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwCfG7UHT9jubtG1M5dH4Bw) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=149) | [Profile (i☆Ris)](https://iris.dive2ent.com/profile/member.php?id=1000227)


A Japanese voice actress and singer. She's currently a member of the idol group [i☆Ris](https://anilist.co/staff/131442).

[Website](https://yu-serizawa.com/) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=229) | [Profile (i☆Ris)](https://iris.dive2ent.com/profile/member.php?id=1000226) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/@iRis_s_yu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/seriko_is_no.1/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu_Serizawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芹澤優)

Yuu Serizawa is a voice actress and member of the anisong and idol unit [i☆Ris](https://anilist.co/staff/131442), signed to DIVE II Entertainment, a sub-label of Avex Entertainment. She is associated with the color blue in the unit.

**Non-anime roles:**
• Nina - Memento Mori (VG)
• Bay - NIKKE: Goddess of Victory (VG)
• Nicole - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
• Gentildonna - Uma Musume: Pretty Derby (VG)
• Asakura Karen - Heaven Burns Red (VG)
